title: Stock markets are sexist and their punishment of female bosses proves it
text:
How much is a chief executive worth? And what if they are a woman?

The first question is already pretty fraught – the wages and bonuses of the bosses of the biggest companies in the country cause far more arguments than the ‘proper’ pay levels for any other employee.

The second probably sounds facetious, insulting or wildly sexist. But it is a genuine question markets must ask themselves no matter how rational, forward-thinking and data-driven they believe themselves to be, as new evidence suggests female bosses get an unfair hearing.

First, the value of a good boss.
